result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheldon L Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges. Court ordered that all court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheldon L Bryant

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Plea and Sentencing ( 33 pages) commencing 10-27-2022 by Lisa Diamond.

Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS with 105 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS NOT eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Maintain employment.
- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- Driver's license revoked for a period of 6 MONTHS. 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
- Restitution set at $0.00.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  

Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Sheldon L Bryant in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Sheldon L Bryant.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court on behalf of Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Sentencing proceeded.

HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE CHILDS
Defense appeared in court in the morning to request adjournment of Decision. Court granted off record adjournment. Parties notified of next court date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Sheldon L Bryant not in court, in custody.  Amanda Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (13 pages) commencing 06-24-2022, by SANDRA M. KANDZIORA.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Sheldon L Bryant not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sheldon L Bryant in court, appear by video with attorney Amanda Poznanski appear in person.  Defendant Sheldon L Bryant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Poilce Officer B. Rebholz.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Sheldon L Bryant in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Amanda Poznanski in trial this week. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:44 PM Defendant Sheldon L Bryant in court with Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn; both appear by video.  Defendant Sheldon L Bryant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Sheldon L Bryant in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Sheldon L Bryant in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Sheldon L Bryant in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sheldon L Bryant appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
